zone.line: [reverso]
AEschylus Euclid
take Euclid rather than AEschylus as
Plato
my model .—
The having spoken of myself with
unaffected freedom will need little
with the let
apology to a candid, mind; & those
[the] consider that they
who are uncandid may speak as they
les less than
will injure not me, but their own
hearts & minds, by calumny misrepre
sentation.— Whatever talents a person
may possess
has to amuse or instruct others, be they
Ever so inconsiderable, he is yet bound
to exert them; if he cannot amuse
attempt
let if his efforts be ineffectual
the punishment of an acc unaccomplished
purpose
attempt have been sufficient, let none
one trouble themselves to heap the dust
of Oblivion upon his hopes efforts.—
the
pile they raise will betray the spot his grave
Asia & the spirit have entered the cave
which might otherwise have been unknown
is already trembling upon .
